title: Toxic Player Island
body:
Is there any chance we can review the topic of Toxic Player Island?

If you are report as being toxic, get queued with likewise toxic players until you can prove that you are otherwise.

E.g. If you spend more time flaming than playing, get sent to the island.

Keep them together instead of them moving from game to game, and wasting 30 minutes of everyone else's time.

replies.body:
This is something that has been suggested quite a bit, and something that [Riot stands firmly against](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2017/01/ask-riot-banished-to-prisoners-island/). 

Their two reasons and the explanations behind it are pretty logical if you think about it.
> Reason One: We believe in a real shot at reform for unsportsmanlike players

>Reason Two: Prisoner’s island is a truly awful experience for the “prisoners” in more ways than one

Honestly if Tyler1 can reform and take on a more positive approach to league, then anyone can. Some people just need that extra push. 

Its more of a matter of finding ways to reward summoners who aren't jerks (things like the clash limits and bettering the honor system) to further incentive's being either a neutral or positive teammate, as well as to continue to better the detection and punishment systems in place for antisocial behavior for typing and in game actions.
I agree with reason one, but not reason two. If reason two was the case, gaols would not exist and we'd be releasing people on to the street straight away.

Keep in mind that the flaw with prisons is not in the concept, but in the application. In most countries, they're treated as being more about "containing the undesirables" (similarly to the "prisoner island" concept) rather than genuine attempts at reform, which is a major factor in reduced reform rates (there's a reason that Norway's prisons have the highest rate of success).

Ultimately, one of the best ways to help people reform is to treat them as much like everyone else (with the same basic rights) while incentivising reform, otherwise they'll tend to feel isolated and forgotten, which will just incentivise more destructive behaviour.

I think the game needs to be looked at as a whole. Think about it most people who rage are the ones who think they are doing better then others, the game needs more ways to reward people who deserved a win but still lost, the game also needs a voice chat like every other competitive game on the planet. Please tell me a team that has one the world cup with no voice comms and only pings, of course not because voice comms is what you use in a competitive scenario.

This started off so well.
>I think the game needs to be looked at as a whole.

Then it just went down hill
> most people who rage are the ones who think they are doing better then others

In what universe is AFKing after inting and blaming someone who had nothing to do with their inting, doing better than others?

>game needs more ways to reward people who deserved a win but still lost

Look, while you're right, you're wrong too.  While this is a good idea in theory, it's a team game, and this is just forcing an "I" in "Team" (yeah that whole no I in team thing)

>the game also needs a voice chat like every other competitive game on the planet

If I want to listen to kids screech about failing and blaming others for it, I'd play Overwatch or HotS
